tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE products (
    product_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    product_name VARCHAR(255),
    manufacturer VARCHAR(255),
    testing_date DATE,
    test_result BOOLEAN
);

CREATE TABLE TestReports (
    report_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    product_id INT,
    test_date DATE,
    tester_name VARCHAR(50),
    test_result VARCHAR(50),
    FOREIGN KEY (product_id) REFERENCES ProductTestingResults(product_id)
);

CREATE TABLE TestResult (
  result_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  product_id INT NOT NULL,
  test_date DATE NOT NULL,
  result VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
  tester VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
  FOREIGN KEY (product_id) REFERENCES Product(product_id)
);

CREATE TABLE ProductStandard (
  product_id INT NOT NULL,
  standard_id INT NOT NULL,
  PRIMARY KEY (product_id, standard_id),
  FOREIGN KEY (product_id) REFERENCES Product(product_id),
  FOREIGN KEY (standard_id) REFERENCES RegulatoryStandards(standard_id)
);

CREATE TABLE TestResult (
    result_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    product_id INT,
    test_date DATE,
    test_passed BOOLEAN,
    test_description TEXT,
    FOREIGN KEY (product_id) REFERENCES Product(product_id)
);

CREATE TABLE TestAssignment (
    assignment_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    technician_id INT,
    product_id INT,
    assigned_date DATE,
    FOREIGN KEY (technician_id) REFERENCES TestTechnician(technician_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (product_id) REFERENCES Product(product_id)
);
